page.title: 02Geography
page.content: The area includes Wysall and Widmer- pool villages and Keyworth Wolds.The landscape is undulating wold country with high ground to the eastern, southern, western and northern sides and a tongue of high land, height from 86m to 80m, running down from NE to SW (640293 to 631285). The highest points are on the northern edge, both 93m (625298 and 632298) and the lowest on the north-western edge below 45m (600297). One small brook, the Fairham Brook, crosses the area from E to NW, 640284 (approx. 65m) to 600297, a fall of 20m in this area; the Roehoe Brook joins at 621282 (approx. 55m) flowing from NE at 640295 (72m). In times of heavy rain the Fairham Brook is liable to flooding in the lower areas. The steepest section of road is Keyworth Road, Wysall, gradient 1 in 17 (604290 to 604285).
